intro: Erythrina buesgenii, commonly known as the flame tree or red flame tree, is a tropical legume belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in dense, fluffy clusters, often resembling flames. The plant has pinnate leaves with three to five leaflets and produces long, slender pods that contain flat, fibrous seeds. Native to South America, it is often cultivated as an ornamental tree due to its vibrant floral display. Its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various soil types make it a popular choice for landscaping in warm climates.
